Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES A FOUNDATION IN ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS FOR A BUSINESS ORGANIZATION. TOPICS COVERED INCLUDE BUSINESS PROCESSES, FINANCIAL RISKS, INTERNAL CONTROLS, AND THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM (AIS).
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.	IDENTIFY AND EXPLAIN THE CHARACTERISTICS OF AN ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM.
2.	IDENTIFY AND EXPLAIN THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A COMPUTERIZED RELATIONAL DATABASE.
3.	CONTRAST AND COMPARE THE BUSINESS PROCESS AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS OF AN ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM.
4.	IDENTIFY AND EXPLAIN MONITORING, AUDITING, AND EVALUATING ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS.
5.	EXPLAIN THE DIFFERENT CONTROL SYSTEMS AND THEIR WEAKNESSES TO FRAUD AND ERRORS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
